diff_hunk:
@@ -7450,6 +7452,56 @@ def forward(self, x, y, c):
         ge_graph = jit_trace.__getattr__('forward').graph_for(x, y, c)
         self.assertExpectedGraph(ge_graph, 'jit')
 
+    def test_exceptions(self):
+        cu = torch.jit.CompilationUnit('''
+            def foo(cond):
+                if bool(cond):
+                    raise ValueError(3)
+                return 1
+        ''')
+
+        cu.foo(torch.tensor(0))
+        with self.assertRaisesRegex(torch._C.JITException, "Exception"):
body: Well those should be things that users should be able to catch, so it should probably get exposed as a `torch.jit.Exception`
